simultaneously satisfy the filing obligation of the registrant under any of the following provisions:</font></div><div 	<body style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">
<div><a name="s612377D9B53953ECB72B41AB76ED81B4"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:14pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;"><img src="tcccheadera10.jpg" alt="tcccheadera10.jpg" style="height:162px;width:690px;"></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Coca-Cola Reports Continued Momentum in Second Quarter;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Updates Full Year Guidance</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Net Revenues Grew 6%; </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Organic Revenues (Non-GAAP) Grew 6%</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Income Grew 8%; Comparable Currency </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Neutral Operating Income (Non-GAAP) Grew 14%</font></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Margin Was 29.9%; Comparable Operating Margin </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">(Non-GAAP) Was 30.3%, Including the Impact from</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Currency Headwinds and Acquisitions</font></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">EPS Grew 12% to $0.61; Comparable EPS (Non-GAAP) Grew 4% to $0.63, </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Despite a 9% Currency Headwind</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:140%;padding-bottom:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ATLANTA, July 23, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;&#8211; The Coca-Cola Company today reported strong operating results in the second quarter of 2019, driven by consumer-centric innovation, solid core brand performance and improved execution in the marketplace. Reported net revenues and organic revenues (non-GAAP) both grew 6% through balanced volume and price/mix, with all operating segments contributing to organic revenue (non-GAAP) growth. The company continued to gain global value share. The company&#8217;s performance year-to-date led to an update in full year guidance.</font></div><div style="line-height:140%;padding-bottom:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">"Our strategy to transform as a total beverage company has allowed us to continue to win in a growing and vibrant industry," said James Quincey, chairman and CEO of The Coca-Cola Company. "Our progress is positioning the company to create more value for all of our stakeholders, including our shareowners."</font></div><div style="line-height:165%;padding-bottom:8px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.712368168744%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;background-color:#acacac;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#ffffff;font-weight:bold;">Highlights</font></div></td></tr></table></div><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.712368168744%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Quarterly Performance</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Revenues:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Net revenues grew 6% to $10.0 billion. Organic revenues (non-GAAP) grew 6%. Revenue growth was driven by concentrate sales growth of 4% and price/mix growth of 2%.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Margin: </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Operating margin, which included items impacting comparability, was 29.9% versus 29.4% in the prior year. Comparable operating margin (non-GAAP) was 30.3% versus 30.6% in the prior year. Strong underlying operating margin (non-GAAP) expansion was offset by an approximate 185 basis point negative impact from currency headwinds and net acquisitions.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Earnings per share: </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">EPS grew 12% to $0.61. Comparable EPS (non-GAAP) grew 4% to $0.63. Comparable EPS growth included the impact from a 9-point currency headwind.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Market share:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;The company continued to gain value share in total nonalcoholic ready-to-drink (NARTD) beverages.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash flow: </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Year-to-date cash from operations was $4.5 billion, up 68% largely due to strong underlying growth, working capital initiatives and the timing of tax payments. Year-to-date free cash flow (non-GAAP) was $3.7 billion, up 87%.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:14pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:160%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.712368168744%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Company Updates</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Driving sparkling:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Strong performance for the quarter was driven by sparkling soft drinks, led by 4% volume and transaction growth in trademark Coca-Cola. Coca-Cola Zero Sugar continues to perform well, with a seventh consecutive quarter of double-digit volume growth globally. Quarterly performance was further driven by innovation, such as Coca-Cola Plus Coffee, and a modernized marketing strategy for today's consumers. The company reached a first-of-its-kind partnership with Netflix to temporarily bring back 1985&#8217;s New Coke for the July 4 debut of season 3 of the hit series "Stranger Things."</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Growing coffee:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;During the quarter, the company launched the first-ever Costa Coffee ready-to-drink (RTD) chilled product in Great Britain, marking the first major introduction since Coca-Cola acquired Costa earlier this year. The company plans to roll out the product in additional markets in the second half of the year. The brand delivers an authentic coffee taste experience with 30% less sugar than most RTD coffees in Costa&#8217;s core market of Great Britain. The Costa Coffee brand is also expanding through a new agreement with Coca-Cola HBC AG. The agreement will address a broad range of consumer and customer needs across multiple channels and occasions, including roast and ground coffee, RTD offerings and vending. The bottler plans to introduce Costa Coffee in at least 10 markets in 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Expanding energy:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;The first energy drink under the Coca-Cola brand launched in select European countries during the quarter. Coca-Cola Energy features caffeine from naturally derived sources, guarana extracts, B vitamins and no taurine, all with the great Coca-Cola taste and feeling that people know and love. The product has shown early signs of success. Coca-Cola Energy is now available in 14 countries, including recent launches in Japan, Australia and South Africa. The company expects to offer Coca-Cola Energy in 20 markets by the end of 2019, including Mexico and Brazil</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Lifting, shifting and scaling:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Since the company's initial investment in the innocent business in 2009, the innocent team has taken the business from the #1 smoothie brand in the U.K. to the #1 chilled juice brand across Europe. The brand is now expanding into Asia for the first time through a targeted rollout, starting in Tokyo. Innocent is loved by consumers who want more functional and nutritional benefits in their daily diet, in addition to those who enjoy natural, delicious and healthy juices and smoothies.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:5px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-6px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Making progress in packaging:</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;The company continues to make progress on its World Without Waste goals for recycling, recyclable packaging and the use of recycled materials, including these recent milestones:</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Bottlers worldwide continue to introduce more brands in 100% recycled PET (rPET) packaging. Recent launches include the green tea brand Hajime Ichinichi Ippon in Japan; the Romerquelle and Valser water brands in Austria and Switzerland, respectively; Viva water in the Philippines; and San Luis water in Peru. In Western Europe, 100% rPET bottles will be launched for smartwater, Chaudfontaine and Honest by the end of 2019. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Coca-Cola Amatil and Coca-Cola Australia announced that 70% of all PET bottles in the market will be made from 100% rPET by the end of 2019.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Coca-Cola European Partners and Coca-Cola Great Britain announced a switch from green to clear bottles for Sprite in their markets as a way to improve recycling. Other markets are making this change as well.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Coca-Cola Beverages Philippines, the bottling arm of Coca-Cola in the Philippines, announced that it will lead the investment in a $19 million state-of-the-art, food-grade recycling facility that will collect, sort, clean and wash post-consumer recyclable plastic bottles and turn them into new bottles using advanced technology. It is    Coca-Cola&#8217;s first major investment in a recycling facility in Southeast Asia.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:145%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:145%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Coca-Cola Vietnam led the launch of an industry-backed packaging recovery organization alongside other companies. The organization will initially focus on increasing recovery and recycling rates for three materials: PET, aluminum and Tetra Pak</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">Tetra Pak</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:5pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;is a U.S. registered trademark of Tetra Laval Holdings &amp; Finance S.A.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2</font></div></div><hr Therefore, the percentages are not calculable. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:165%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">In addition to the data in the preceding tables, operating results in the quarter included the following:</font></div><div style="line-height:165%;padding-bottom:8px;text-align:center;padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Price/mix grew 2% for the quarter through solid pricing in the marketplace across all operating segments. Category cluster performance was as follows:</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Sparkling soft drinks grew 3%, driven by strong 4% global growth in trademark Coca-Cola, including growth in original Coca-Cola and continued double-digit growth in Coca-Cola Zero Sugar.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">3</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:14pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Juice, dairy and plant-based beverages volume was even as strong performance in the Maaza brand in India and the innocent business across Europe was offset by a decline in Rani, the leading juice brand in the Middle East.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Water, enhanced water and sports drinks grew 2%, led by the Ciel and Cristal brands in Mexico as well as the Kinley brand in India, partially offset by a decline in the company's water brands in Japan. The decline in Japan was primarily due to deprioritization of low-margin commodity water brands.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Tea and coffee volume declined 3% as growth in Fuze Tea across Europe and Mexico was offset by a decline in the do&#287;adan tea business in Turkey, in addition to the company's tea brands in Japan.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Operating income grew 8% including a negative impact from currency. Comparable currency neutral operating income (non-GAAP) grew 14%. Operating income growth was driven by strong organic revenue (non-GAAP) growth, a benefit from acquisitions and ongoing productivity initiatives.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:165%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Europe, Middle East &amp; Africa</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Price/mix grew 1% for the quarter, which included a 2-point headwind from geographic mix due to strong growth across key African markets, including South Africa and Nigeria.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Unit case volume grew 2%, as growth across the majority of markets was partially offset by declines in Zimbabwe and the Middle East. Growth was led by sparkling soft drinks and Fuze Tea.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Operating income declined 5%, primarily due to a 14-point currency headwind. Comparable currency neutral operating income (non-GAAP) grew 9%, primarily driven by organic revenue (non-GAAP) growth in addition to a benefit from the timing of expenses</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The company gained value share in total NARTD beverages, led by solid share performance across Europe, in addition to gaining share across all category clusters.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:165%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Latin America</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; Operating income growth was largely driven by the benefit of strong pricing in the marketplace.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; Positive performance in trademark Coca-Cola was driven by double-digit growth in Coca-Cola Zero Sugar and innovation such as Coca-Cola Orange Vanilla.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">4</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:14pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:150%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:150%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Operating income grew 10%. water, enhanced water and sports drinks; and juice, dairy and plant-based beverages.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:165%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Asia Pacific</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; As a result, CCBA is now presented within the company&#8217;s results from continuing operations and is included in the Bottling Investments operating segment.</font></div></td></tr></table><table style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-left:6px;text-indent:-6px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:5pt">1 </sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">For Bottling Investments, this represents the percent change in net revenues attributable to the increase (decrease) in unit case volume computed based on total sales (rather than average daily sales) in each of the corresponding periods after considering the impact of structural changes.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-left:6px;text-indent:-6px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:5pt">2 </sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">Organic revenues, comparable currency neutral operating income and comparable currency neutral EPS are non-GAAP financial measures. Refer to the Reconciliation of GAAP and Non-GAAP Financial Measures section.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-left:6px;text-indent:-6px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:5pt">3 </sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">With the exception of RTD products, Costa sales are not included in concentrate sales, price/mix or unit case volume.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-left:6px;text-indent:-6px;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:5pt">4 </sup></font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">Reported operating income for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">six months ended</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">June&#160;28, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;was $219 million. Reported operating loss for the six months ended </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">June&#160;29, 2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;">&#32;was $342 million. Therefore, the percentages are not calculable. </font></div><div style="line-height:150%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The 2019 outlook information provided below includes forward-looking non-GAAP financial measures, which management uses in measuring performance. The company is not able to reconcile full year 2019 projected organic revenues (non-GAAP) to full year 2019 projected reported net revenues, full year 2019 projected comparable currency neutral net revenues (non-GAAP) to full year 2019 projected reported net revenues, full year 2019 projected comparable currency neutral operating income (non-GAAP) to full year 2019 projected reported operating income, or full year 2019 projected comparable EPS (non-GAAP) to full year 2019 projected reported EPS without unreasonable efforts because it is not possible to predict with a reasonable degree of certainty the actual impact of changes in foreign currency exchange rates; the exact timing and amount of acquisitions, divestitures and/or structural changes; and the exact timing and amount of comparability items throughout 2019. The unavailable information could have a significant impact on full year 2019 GAAP financial results.</font></div><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;background-color:#828282;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#ffffff;font-weight:bold;">Notes</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">All references to growth rate percentages and share compare the results of the period to those of the prior year comparable period.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">All references to volume and volume percentage changes indicate unit case volume, unless otherwise noted. All volume percentage changes are computed based on average daily sales, unless otherwise noted. "Unit case" means a unit of measurement equal to 24 eight-ounce servings of finished beverage. "Unit case volume" means the number of unit cases (or unit case equivalents) of company beverages directly or indirectly sold by the company and its bottling partners to customers.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">"Concentrate sales" represents the amount of concentrates, syrups, beverage bases, source waters and powders/minerals (in all instances expressed in equivalent unit cases) sold by, or used in finished beverages sold by, the company to its bottling partners or other customers. In the reconciliation of reported net revenues, "concentrate sales" represents the percent change in net revenues attributable to the increase (decrease) in concentrate sales volume for the geographic operating segments and the Global Ventures operating segment (excluding Costa non-RTD sales) (expressed in equivalent unit cases) after considering the impact of structural changes. For the Bottling Investments operating segment, this represents the percent change in net revenues attributable to the increase (decrease) in unit case volume computed based on total sales (rather than average daily sales) in each of the corresponding periods after considering the impact of structural changes. The Bottling Investments operating segment reflects unit case volume growth for consolidated bottlers only. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">"Price/mix" represents the change in net operating revenues caused by factors such as price changes, the mix of products and packages sold, and the mix of channels and geographic territories where the sales occurred.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:140%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:140%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">First quarter 2019 financial results were impacted by one less day as compared to the same period in 2018, and fourth quarter 2019 financial results will be impacted by one additional day as compared to the same period in 2018. Unit case volume results for the quarters are not impacted by the variances in days due to the average daily sales computation referenced above.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;padding-left:72px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:center;padding-left:24px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;background-color:#828282;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#ffffff;font-weight:bold;">Conference Call</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:140%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The company is hosting a conference call with investors and analysts to discuss second quarter 2019 operating results today, July 23, 2019, at 8:30 a.m. ET. The company invites participants to listen to a live webcast of the conference call on the company&#8217;s website, http://www.coca-colacompany.com, in the "Investors" section. An audio replay in downloadable digital format and a transcript of the call will be available on the website within 24 hours following the call. Further, the "Investors" section of the website includes certain supplemental information and a reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures to the company&#8217;s results as reported under GAAP which may be used during the call when discussing financial results.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Contacts:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div
